resources:
Key Mapper developer.sds100@gmail.com Unleash your keys!
No action chosen Key Mapper needs to use an accessibility service so it can listen to button/key presses and perform the actions you\'ve chosen. The accessibility service only listens for key events and detects which app you are in. You can look at the source code, which is linked in the About screen, to verify this. %d selected Key Mapper Basic Input Method Enable Open ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯ ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\n\nNothing here! Record a trigger! Add an action! ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\n\nCreate a key map! ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\n\nYou haven\'t chosen any actions for this shortcut! You haven\'t created any key maps! Everything looks good! The app will work but some things might need fixing depending on what you\'re doing. Your device doesn\'t support some actions. Trigger is released Trigger is pressed again
Show hidden apps Modifiers Toggle Play Store F-Droid GitHub IMPORTANT!!! These coordinates are only correct when your display is in the same orientation as the screenshot! This action will cancel any touches or gestures you are doing on the screen.\n\nIf you need help finding the coordinates of a point on your screen take a screenshot and then tap on the screenshot where you want this action to press. Don\'t know device name! Tap actions to fix! Tap constraints to fix! Perform actions Hold down until trigger is… No device ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\n\nNo extras! Create a new key map Done configuring key event action Done picking coordinate Key Mapper log Send to
What\'s New Click the key on the device which you want to be entered. \n\nIMPORTANT! Inputting this key as an action will only work if you are using a Key Mapper compatible keyboard. IMPORTANT! Inputting this key code as an action will only work if you are using a Key Mapper compatible keyboard. The sound file will be copied to Key Mapper\'s private data folder, which means your actions will still work even if the file is moved or deleted. It will also be backed up with your key maps in the zip folder. You can delete saved sound files in the settings.
Type some text you want to be inserted when you perform this action. Enter the phone number. Type a URL which you want to be opened. The http://, https:// or www. isn\'t required. Can\'t find any paired devices. Is Bluetooth turned on? The \"trigger from other apps\" option will be turned on for the key map that you select if it isn\'t already. If you turn this option off later then any shortcuts or Intents to trigger this key map will not work.
Enabled Disabled
Reset Exception in onKeyEvent. Look in logcat. Once you have enabled the device admin, you must DEACTIVATE it if you want to uninstall Key Mapper.
Add a constraint!
Wait %sms
Key Mapper bug report Please describe the issue you\'re having...
Start activity: %s Start service: %s Send broadcast: %s
Key map UUID Use shell (ROOT only)
Key Mapper requires permission to modify the Do Not Disturb mode if you want the buttons to work as expected in Do Not Disturb mode! This trigger will not work as expected in Do Not Disturb mode! The option to trigger when the screen is off needs root permission to work! The option to trigger when the screen is off will not work!
Your mappings will stop working randomly! Your mappings are paused! Unpause The accessibility service needs to be turned on for your mappings to work! Your phone killed Key Mapper when it was in the background or it crashed! The accessibility service is enabled! Your mappings should work. Extra logging is turned on! Turn this off if you aren\'t trying to fix an issue. Turn off

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=io.github.sds100.keymapper.inputmethod.latin https://f-droid.org/en/packages/io.github.sds100.keymapper.inputmethod.latin https://github.com/sds100/KeyMapperKeyboard/releases
https://github.com/sds100/KeyMapperLeanbackKeyboard/releases
https://github.com/sds100/KeyMapper/issues/new/choose
Choose action
Turn off app killing Follow the amazing guide at dontkillmyapp.com that shows you how to turn off all the app killing "features" on your phone.
\n\nOnce you have read the guide you will need to go to the next slide and restart the accessibility service. Open guide
Restart the accessibility service The accessibility service must be restarted. Turn it off and on. Restart
Report a bug Choose a location to save the bug report to by tapping "create report". The next slide will tell how you can you can send it to the developer. Create report
Share the report There are 3 ways to share the bug report to the developer. Either join the Discord server or create a GitHub issue. Make sure that you attach the bug report to your message! Discord GitHub
Settings Done Select all About Search Quick Start Guide Help Enable Disable Disable all Enable all Report bug Show input method picker Seed database Save Duplicate Back up Restore Back up everything Back up all Tap to pause Tap to resume Reset Save Toggle short messages Copy Clear
Add action Record trigger Done Save Fix %d… Add constraint Choose Key code Yes! Choose action Add extra Create launcher shortcut Intent guide Help Select Screenshot (optional) Choose activity Set flags Copy No limit Choose sound file Edit action Replace action
Are you sure? Create shortcut title Root permission needed! More Pick stream Choose flash Can\'t find the accessibility settings page Can\'t record trigger? Are you sure you want to leave without saving? If you know your phone isn\'t rooted or you don\'t know what root is, you can\'t use features which only work on rooted devices. When you tap \'OK\', you will be taken to the settings. In the settings, scroll to the bottom and tap \'Key Mapper has root permission\' so you can use root features/actions. Downloading… Can you please describe the issue you are having in the email, otherwise I can\'t help you. Thanks! Long pressing only works for physical volume and navigation buttons. If you enable it for other keys, the keys won\'t work when they aren\'t long pressed.
Grant WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission A PC/Mac is required to grant this permission. Read the online guide.
Your device doesn\'t seem to have an accessibility services settings page. You can enable the accessibility service by giving the app WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission. After you tap \'okay\' a popup will guide you how to do it. "Multiple keys can't be double pressed at the same time." The keys need to be listed from top to bottom in the order that they will be held down. A \"sequence\" trigger has a timeout unlike parallel triggers. This means after you press the first key, you will have a set amount of time to input the rest of the keys in the trigger. All the keys that you have added to the trigger won\'t do their usual action until the timeout has been reached. You can change this timeout in the "Options" tab. Android doesn\'t allow apps to get a list of connected (not paired) Bluetooth devices. Apps can only detect when they are connected and disconnected. So if your Bluetooth device is already connected to your device when the accessibility service starts, you will have to reconnect it for the app to know it is connected. Change location or turn off automatic back up? Screen on/off constraints will only work if you have turned on the \"detect trigger when screen is off\" key map option. This option will only show for some keys (e.g volume buttons) and if you are rooted. See a list of supported keys on the Help page. If you have any other screen lock chosen, such as PIN or Pattern then you don\'t have to worry. But if you have a Password screen lock you will *NOT* be able to unlock your phone if you use the Key Mapper Basic Input Method because it doesn\'t have a GUI. You can grant Key Mapper WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission so it can show a notification to switch to and from the keyboard. There is a guide on how to do this if you tap the question mark at the bottom of the screen. Select the input method for actions that require one. You can change this later by tapping \"Select keyboard for actions\" in the bottom menu of the home screen. You need to choose the \"Caps Lock to camera\" keyboard layout for your keyboard otherwise the Caps Lock key will still lock caps. You can find this setting in your device settings -> Languages and Input -> Physical Keyboard -> Tap on your keyboard -> Set Up Keyboard Layouts. This will remap the Caps Lock key to KEYCODE_CAMERA so Key Mapper can remap it properly.\n\nAfter you\'ve done this you must remove the Caps Lock trigger key and record the Caps Lock key again. It should say \"Camera\" instead of \"Caps Lock\" if you did the steps correctly. Reboot your device if the "Record trigger" button is counting down and the buttons that you are pressing aren\'t showing up. If your buttons are still not showing up after rebooting then Key Mapper doesn\'t support your buttons. There isn\'t a fix for this. No external devices connected.
Install the Key Mapper GUI Keyboard This is highly recommended! This is a proper keyboard that you can use with Key Mapper. The one built-in to Key Mapper (the Basic Input Method) has no on-screen keyboard. Choose where you want to install it from.
Install the Key Mapper Leanback Keyboard This is highly recommended! This is a proper keyboard for Android TV that you can use with Key Mapper. The one built-in to Key Mapper (the Basic Input Method) has no on-screen keyboard. Choose where you want to install it from.
Install the Key Mapper GUI Keyboard Choose where you want to download it from.
Install the Key Mapper Leanback Keyboard Choose where you want to download it from.
This action needs some extra setting up There are 3 ways that you can set up your device to use this action. Here are the advantages and disadvantages of each.
\n\n1. Download Shizuku (recommended). You do not have to use a different on-screen keyboard to the one that you are already using but it will require a minute of setting up every time you reboot your device.
\n\n2. Download the Key Mapper GUI Keyboard. This is an on-screen keyboard that you can use with Key Mapper but you will not be able to use the keyboard that you are currently using, such as Gboard.
\n\n3. Do nothing and use the built-in Key Mapper keyboard. This is not recommended since you will have no on-screen keyboard when you use Key Mapper! There are no advantages.
This action needs some extra setting up There are 3 ways that you can set up your device to use this action. Here are the advantages and disadvantages of each.
\n\n1. Download Shizuku (recommended). You do not have to use a different on-screen keyboard to the one that you are already using but it will require a minute of setting up every time you reboot your device.
\n\n2. Download the Key Mapper Leanback Keyboard. This is an on-screen keyboard optimised for Android TV that you can use with Key Mapper but you will not be able to use the keyboard that you are currently using, such as Gboard.
\n\n3. Do nothing and use the built-in Key Mapper keyboard. This is not recommended since you will have no on-screen keyboard when you use Key Mapper! There are no advantages.
Disable battery optimisation You MUST read this all otherwise you will get frustrated in the future!\n\nTapping \"fix partially\" might prevent Android from stopping the app while it is in the background.\n\nThis is NOT ENOUGH. Your OEM\'s skin such as MIUI or Samsung Experience may have other app killing features so you MUST turn them off for Key Mapper as well by following the online guide at dontkillmyapp.com.
Send feedback Please read the guide on how to report issues on the website.
Turn on the accessibility service so that you can record a trigger. Restart the accessibility service by turning it off and on so that you can record a trigger.
Turn on the accessibility service so that you can test the action. Restart the accessibility service by turning it off and on so that you can test the action. Restart the accessibility service by turning it off and on.
Using this trigger may cause a black screen when you unlock your device after using the screen pinning setting in your device\'s settings. This can be fixed with a reboot. This doesn\'t happen on all devices so beware and turn off the setting if it does!
Reset fingerprint gesture maps Are you sure that you want to reset your fingerprint gesture maps?
Key Mapper has been killed or crashed It is very likely that your phone killed Key Mapper while it was trying to run in the background. This is not the developer\'s fault and there is nothing they can do to fix it so please don\'t leave a bad review 😃.
\n\nHave you followed the guide on dontkillmyapp.com before to stop your phone from killing Key Mapper? Yes No
Failed to create bug report
Request Shizuku permission Since you are using Shizuku it is highly recommended to grant this permission since some features in Key Mapper can be done without you having to configure anything (E.g inputting key codes without using the Key Mapper keyboard).
Yes Done Opt in Guide Guide Enable root features Grant Join Change Fix partially Ok Turn on Restart Never show again Open online guide
Turn off Stay out No Cancel Don\'t show again
Online guide Settings Docs Changelog Report bug
Restart Go to guide
Shizuku Key Mapper GUI Keyboard Key Mapper Leanback Keyboard Do nothing
Cancel Fix
Keyboard picker Pause/Resume mappings Keyboard is hidden warning Toggle Key Mapper keyboard New features
Tap to change your keyboard. Keyboard picker
Running Tap to open Key Mapper. Pause
Paused Tap to open Key Mapper. Resume
Dismiss
Restart
Accessibility service disabled Tap to start the accessibility service.
Accessibility service needs restarting! The accessibility service has crashed! Your phone might be aggressively killing it! Tap to restart the accessibility service.
Stop service
Keyboard is hidden! Tap \'show keyboard\' to start showing the keyboard again.
Toggle Key Mapper keyboard Tap \'toggle\' to switch to and from the Key Mapper keyboard. Toggle
Remap fingerprint gestures with Key Mapper! Your device supports remapping swipes on the fingerprint sensor. Tap to start remapping!
You need to setup some settings again! It looks like you were using the setting to automatically change the keyboard or show the input method picker when a Bluetooth device connects and disconnects. Key Mapper now allows you to use any input device and not just Bluetooth devices. There isn\'t a way to migrate the old settings in a way that the new functionality will work so you\'ll have to choose the devices again in the Key Mapper settings. Tap to open Key Mapper.
Default long press delay (ms) How long a button should be pressed for it to be detected as a long press. Default is 500ms. Can be overridden in a key map\'s options.
Default double press duration (ms) How fast does a button have to be double pressed for it to be detected as a double press. Default is 300ms. Can be overridden in a key map\'s options.
How long to vibrate if vibrating is enabled for a key map. Default is 200ms. Can be overridden in a key map\'s options. Default vibrate duration (ms)
How long the trigger needs to be held down for the action to start repeating. Default is 400ms. Can be overridden in a key map\'s options. Default delay until repeat (ms)
The delay between every time an action is repeated. Default is 50ms. Can be overridden in a key map\'s options. Default delay between repeats (ms)
The time allowed to complete a sequence trigger. Default is 1000ms. Can be overridden in a key map\'s options. Default sequence trigger timeout (ms)
Reset
Force all key maps to vibrate. Force vibrate
Keyboard picker notification Show a persistent notification to allow you to pick a keyboard.
Pause/resume mappings notification Show a persistent notification which starts/pauses your mappings.
Automatically back up mappings to a specified location No location chosen.
Choose devices
Automatically show keyboard picker When a device that you have chosen connects or disconnects the keyboard picker will show automatically. Choose the devices below.
Automatically change the on-screen keyboard when a device (e.g a keyboard) connects/disconnects The last used Key Mapper keyboard will be automatically selected when a chosen device is connected. Your normal keyboard will be automatically selected when the device disconnects.
Automatically change the on-screen keyboard when you start inputting text The last used non Key Mapper keyboard will be automatically selected when you try to open the keyboard. Your Key Mapper keyboard will be automatically selected once you stop using the keyboard.
Show an on-screen message when automatically changing the keyboard
Key Mapper has root permission Enable this if you want to use features/actions which only work on rooted devices. Key Mapper must have root permission from your root-access-management app (e.g Magisk, SuperSU) for these features to work. Only turn this on if you know your device is rooted and you have given Key Mapper root permission.
Dark theme
Notification settings
Switch between the Key Mapper keyboard and your default keyboard when you tap the notification. Toggle Key Mapper keyboard notification
Automatically change the keyboard when toggling key maps Automatically select the Key Mapper keyboard when you resume your key maps and select your default keyboard when pausing them.
Hide home screen alerts Hide the alerts at the top of the home screen.
Show the first 5 characters of the device id for device specific triggers This is useful to differentiate between devices that have the same name.
Workaround for Android 11 bug This fixes keyboards that don\'t work when any accessibility services are enabled.
Workaround for Android 11 bug that sets the device id for input events to -1 Workaround for Android 11 bug that sets the device id for input events to -1
Select the devices that Key Mapper should intercept all key events and then reroute through the chosen Key Mapper keyboard. You MUST be using the Key Mapper GUI Keyboard or the Key Mapper Basic Input Method for this to work. This is a partial workaround for https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/163120692. This will NOT work with game controllers. 4. Choose devices
1. Install the Key Mapper GUI Keyboard (optional) 1. Install the Key Mapper Leanback Keyboard (optional)
2. Enable the Key Mapper GUI Keyboard or the Key Mapper Basic Input Method 2. Enable the Key Mapper Leanback Keyboard or the Key Mapper Basic Input Method
3. Use the keyboard that you just enabled (Recommended) Read user guide for this setting.
Enable extra logging View and share log Report issue
Delete sound files Delete sound files that can be used for the Sound action.
Grant permission Permission granted
1. Shizuku is not installed! Tap to download the Shizuku app. 1. Shizuku is installed.
2. Shizuku is not started! Tap to open the Shizuku app and then read their instructions that explain how to start it. 2. Shizuku is started.
3. Key Mapper does not have permission to use Shizuku. Tap to grant this permission. 3. Key Mapper will automatically use Shizuku. Tap to read which Key Mapper features use Shizuku.
Default mapping options Change the default options for your mappings.
Automatically show the keyboard picker Tap to see the settings that allow you to automatically show the keyboard picker.
Notifications Defaults
Root settings These options will only work on root devices! If you don\'t know what root is or whether your device is rooted, please don\'t leave a poor review if they don\'t work. :)
Require WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission These options are only enabled if Key Mapper has WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission. Click the button below to learn how to grant the permission.
Shizuku support Shizuku is an app that allows Key Mapper to do things that only system apps can do. You don\'t need to use the Key Mapper keyboard for example. Tap to learn how to set this up. Follow these steps to set up Shizuku.
Automatically change the keyboard These are really useful settings and you are recommended to check them out!
Logging This may add latency to your key maps so only turn this on if you are trying to debug the app or have been asked to by the developer.
Changelog License Privacy policy Credits Source code Developer\'s GitHub profile Rate and review XDA thread Version Translate Discord server YouTube channel (Tutorials)
@string/on
@string/off
@string/follow_system
Show volume dialog Long press Vibrate Show an on-screen message Vibrate when keys are initially pressed and again when long pressed. Detect trigger when the screen is off
Repeat %dx after %dms every %dms until swiped again until pressed again until released
Repeat Repeat until released Repeat until pressed again
Hold down Hold down until pressed again Do not override default action Hold down until swiped again Trigger from other apps
Accessibility service is enabled :) All good.
Restart the accessibility service The accessibility services is enabled but it has been killed by your phone or it has crashed. Restart it. Restart
Enable the accessibility service Your key maps will only work once you have enabled the accessibility service. It also needs to be turned on to create a trigger.
The accessibility service is disabled You can only record a trigger if the accessibility service is enabled.
Note from the developer There is no guarantee that every action will work on your device and that every button can be detected. This is because there are many flavours of Android, and OEMs can break features by accident or intentionally. If something doesn\'t work, please notify the developer and refrain from giving the app a poor rating since the issue is often out of the developer\'s control. =)
Key Mapper may stop working randomly! CRITICAL!!! Tap \"turn off\" to hopefully prevent Android from stopping the app while it is in the background. Your OEM\'s skin such as MIUI or Samsung Experience may have other \"battery saving\" features so you MUST turn them off for Key Mapper as well by following the guide at dontkillmyapp.com Stock Android battery optimisation is off. This is not good enough for most devices so go to dontkillmyapp.com for tutorials which show how to turn off even more app-killing features on your device. Turn off Go to dontkillmyapp.com
Remapping volume buttons? You can remap volume buttons Key Mapper needs Do Not Disturb access if you want actions which change the volume and remapped volume buttons to work. All good! :)
Contributing "This app is open source! You can start contributing by heading over to the sds100/KeyMapper repo on GitHub and by joining the Discord server. Even if you can\'t code, you can contribute by helping others and testing the latest features." Tap the 3 dots to change the repeat behaviour and more. You can test an action and fix action errors by tapping it.
Remapping fingerprint reader gestures You can remap fingerprint reader gestures! :) You can not remap fingerprint reader gestures!
You\'ll need to enable the accessibility service so that Key Mapper can check whether your device can detect fingerprint gestures. Your device can detect fingerprint gestures! There is a tab at the top of the home screen for remapping fingerprint gestures. Your device does not allow 3rd party apps to detect fingerprint gestures! There isn\'t anything the developer can do about this. Some devices have the setting to swipe down on the fingerprint reader to open the notification drawer and do not allow 3rd party apps to detect fingerprint gestures. Enable
You need to setup some settings again It looks like you were using the setting to automatically change the keyboard or show the input method picker when a Bluetooth device connects and disconnects. Key Mapper now allows you to use any input device and not just Bluetooth devices. There isn\'t a way to migrate the old settings in a way that the new functionality will work so you\'ll have to choose the devices again.
Grant Shizuku permission It looks like you have Shizuku installed. It is recommended to grant Key Mapper permission to use Shizuku so that Key Mapper can do more things without user input. For example input button presses without you having to use the \'Key Mapper keyboard\'. Tap \'more info\' to read all the benefits. Tap \'grant\' to grant the permission.
Shizuku permission granted! You have granted Key Mapper Shizuku permission successfully! More info Grant
Shizuku is not started Shizuku must be started before you grant Key Mapper permission to use it. Tap \'Launch Shizuku\' to open the Shizuku app so that you can start it. Launch Shizuku

Screenshot Launch voice assistant Launch device assistant Open camera
Lock device
Secure lock device You will only be able to log back in with your PIN. The fingerprint scanner and face unlock will be disabled. This is the only reliable way I have found to lock non-rooted devices before Android Pie 9.0.
Sleep/wake device You must turn on the option to detect the trigger when the screen is off!
Do nothing
Move cursor to the end This action may not work as intended in some apps. Toggle keyboard This action will only work if you have tapped on an input field where the keyboard is supposed to be shown. Show keyboard Hide keyboard Show keyboard picker
Switch keyboard Switch to %s
Cut Copy Paste Select word at cursor
Open settings Show power menu
Toggle Airplane mode Enable Airplane mode Disable Airplane mode

Tap screen Input text Open URL Send intent Start phone call Play sound Dismiss most recent notification Dismiss all notifications
Navigation Volume Media Keyboard Apps Input Camera & Sound Connectivity Content Interface Phone Display Notifications
Boolean Boolean array Integer Integer array String String array Long Long array Byte Byte array Double Double array Char Char array Float Float array Short Short array
Can only be \"true\" or \"false\" A comma-separated list of "true" and "false". E.g true,false,true A valid Integer in the Java programming language. A comma-separated list of valid Integers in the Java programming language. E.g 100,399 A comma separated list. E.g category1,category2 Any text. A comma separated list of strings. E.g string1,string2 A valid Long in the Java programming language. A comma-separated list of valid Longs in the Java programming language. E.g 102302234234234,399083423234429 A valid Byte in the Java programming language. A comma-separated list of valid Bytes in the Java programming language. E.g 123,3 A valid Double in the Java programming language. A comma-separated list of valid Doubles in the Java programming language. E.g 1.0,3.234 A valid Char in the Java programming language. E.g \'a\' or \'b\' A comma-separated list of valid Chars in the Java programming language. E.g a,b,c A valid Float in the Java programming language. E.g 3.145 A comma-separated list of valid Floats in the Java programming language. E.g 1241.123 A valid Short in the Java programming language. E.g 2342 A comma-separated list of valid Shorts in the Java programming language. E.g 3242,12354
The flags for an Intent are stored as bit flags. These flags alter how the Intent is handled. If this is blank for an Activity Intent then Key Mapper will use FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK by default. For much more information tap \'docs\' to see the Android developers documentation.
